cards.title: HTML
cards.text: Experienced in using HTML, I use it for most of my projects and make use of semantic code structure.

cards.title: CSS
cards.text: Paired with HTML, I make my work stand out by using CSS. I always love experimenting, and CSS helps me with that.

cards.title: SCSS
cards.text: Ever since I found SCSS, I never looked back. Using SCSS, I can work in a categorized way, making my workflow better.

cards.title: Tailwind
cards.text: A quick and easy way to style is what I like to use. I learned this during my internship of 6 months and picked it up fast.

cards.title: JavaScript
cards.text: A site needs to function, and my experience in JS helps me create highly functional sites with data and OOP included.

cards.title: React
cards.text: I started with React, and this portfolio is actually my first big project using it. I like it because it offers a lot of possibilities.

cards.title: Git
cards.text: Experience in using Git for individual and collaborative work.

cards.title: PHP
cards.text: I have used PHP for creating backend projects such as a CMS and am now using it with Laravel.

cards.title: Laravel
cards.text: Recently started using Laravel and learned to understand PHP much better.

cards.title: Docker
cards.text: Familiar with creating and using Docker containers for frontend and backend.

cards.title: WordPress
cards.text: I am familiar with WordPress but prefer to code my work from start to finish.

cards.title: After Effects
cards.text: Experience in creating fun little videos in my spare time using AE.

cards.title: Adobe XD
cards.text: In the absence of designers, I can step in and create the necessary design using XD.

cards.title: Figma
cards.text: In the absence of designers, I can step in and create the necessary design using Figma.
